yaml.title: Understanding Precinct Level Data
yaml.description: A technical guide to the concepts and calculated columns in utah_county_elections.csv

markdown.markdown:
```{=html}

Domain Knowledge

The Precinct

The smallest political unit in the election. It is a specific geographic shape (polygon). Everyone living inside this shape votes at the same location (or gets the same ballot style).

State (Utah)
County (Utah County)
Precinct
Ballot Style
Contest / Race
appears on ballot
Think of it as: State → County → Precinct → Ballot Style → Contest
County
Precinct
Precinct
Precinct
Precinct
Precinct
Precinct
Precinct
Precinct
Precinct

Registration vs. Turnout

Understanding the subset of people who actually generate data.

1,000

voter_registration

People legally allowed to vote within the precinct.

400

voter_turnout

People who submitted a ballot within the precinct.

350
↓ Drop-off (Rolloff)

contest_total_votes

People who voted in a specific race within the precinct.

Vote-for-N Contests

While most races restrict voters to a single vote per candidate (vote_for = 1), some races like City Council races allow voters to vote for multiple candidates (vote_for > 1).

When vote_for > 1, contest_total_votes counts selections, not ballots, contest_total_votes can exceed precinct_ballots_cast and make rolloff_rate look negative.

max possible selections = precinct_ballots_cast × vote_for
precinct_ballots_cast 400 vote_for 2 contest_total_votes 650
Selections in this contest (scaled to max possible selections) 650 / 800
Selections counted (contest_total_votes) Unused selections (undervote)

Data Dictionary

turnout_rate_precinct

How engaged is this neighborhood?

voter_turnout
voter_registration
=
0.45
choice_share

Percentage of the vote this candidate received.

precinct_votes
contest_total_votes
=
Candidate gets the blue slice.
Denominator is Sum of All Candidates.
margin_votes

The vote gap between the top two candidates (Winner − Runner-up).

winner_votes − runnerup_votes
=
Winner1,000
Runner-up800
margin_votes = 200

The red span shows the extra votes the winner has beyond the runner-up.

rolloff_rate

Voters who ignored this specific race.

( precinct_ballots_cast - contest_total_votes )
precinct_ballots_cast
=
Voted
Blank
⚠️ Negative Rolloff? In "Vote for 2" races, Total Votes > Ballots Cast. Rolloff becomes negative. This is normal.
polarization_fragmentation

Simpson Index: How split is the vote?

1 − Σ( precinct_votes / contest_total_votes )2
=
0.1
Landslide
0.8
Fractured

Higher values mean votes are spread across more choices; lower values mean one choice dominates.

```
